user.title: Where to save your config
user.description:
Choose where to save your generated Frigate configuration file.

Optionally connect directly to Frigate to apply changes automatically.

data_description.output_path: File path for the generated frigate.yml (e.g., /config/frigate.yml)
data_description.frigate_url: Your Frigate web interface URL (e.g., http://192.168.1.100:5000)
data_description.auto_push: Automatically send the config to Frigate and restart it whenever you generate

hardware.title: Your hardware setup
hardware.description:
Tell us about your hardware so we can optimize Frigate for best performance.

Not sure? The defaults work well for most Intel systems with a Coral TPU.

data_description.detector_type: What hardware runs AI object detection? Coral TPU is fastest and recommended.
data_description.detector_device: Device path like /dev/bus/usb/001/002 for USB Coral, or 'pci' for PCIe Coral
data_description.hwaccel: How to decode video streams. VAAPI for Intel, CUDA for NVIDIA.
data_description.network_interfaces: Network interfaces connected to cameras (comma-separated, e.g., eth0, br0)

mqtt.title: MQTT connection
mqtt.description:
Frigate needs MQTT to communicate with Home Assistant.

{mqtt_detected}

data.mqtt_auto: Use my Home Assistant MQTT broker

data_description.mqtt_auto: Recommended: Uses the same MQTT broker as Home Assistant
data_description.mqtt_host: Hostname or IP address of your MQTT broker
data_description.mqtt_user: Leave blank if no authentication required
data_description.mqtt_password: Leave blank if no authentication required

features.title: Frigate features
features.description:
Enable the AI features you want. Each feature uses additional CPU/GPU resources.

You can always change these later.

data.birdseye_mode: When to show cameras in Birdseye

retention.title: How long to keep recordings
retention.description:
Set how many days to keep different types of recordings.

Longer retention = more storage space needed.

error.invalid_path: File path must end with .yml or .yaml
error.invalid_url: Please enter a valid URL (e.g., http://frigate:5000)

data_description.auto_groups_from_areas: Automatically create camera groups based on their assigned Home Assistant areas
